duties_responsibilities.duty: Operate front-end trucks to collect and transport waste or recyclables along designated routes.
Perform daily pre- and post-trip inspections of the vehicle and complete vehicle condition reports.
Interact courteously with customers and the general public, addressing their questions and requests.
Maintain clean customer sites and ensure safety along roads and highways by cleaning loose trash.
Submit required logs, route sheets, and vehicle condition reports as per company policy and legal requirements.
Follow safe operating practices and procedures, including equipment checks and lockout/tagout protocols.
Monitor operations for loose debris and visually scan customer sites before and after dumping.
Sustain a motivated workforce by screening, hiring, training, developing, and evaluating personnel.
Adhere to wage and hour laws, compensate personnel in accordance with guidelines, and practice progressive discipline for employee performance issues.
Ensure safe working conditions, plan and operate landfill operations efficiently, and conduct annual performance reviews for employees.
Schedule and conduct safety meetings, document attendees, and establish and review productivity standards.
Promote and uphold an effective safety program, investigate accidents, and ensure proper supply and usage of safety equipment.
Conform with applicable laws, regulations, and company policies, and perform other duties as required by management.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree from a four-year college or university and/or demonstrated record of serving in an operational environment requiring analytical and general management skills.
Five or more years of experience in the waste or landfill industry or equivalent combination of required education and experience.
Proficiency with operation of dump truck, bull dozer, compactor, track hoe, loader, and backhoe.
Acquire and maintain the SWANA Manager of Landfill Operations certification.
